private_information: I am a truck and the only thing that can move between places.
Driving between any two places takes 10 time units.
During driving I am not considered at either origin or destination (I am unavailable for co-located over-all conditions).
I can carry crates that hoists load into me and hoists can unload crates from me.
truck0.goal: Follow the orchestrator's plan to move between places to enable crate transport and goal stacking.

private_information: I am a truck and the only thing that can move between places.
Driving between any two places takes 10 time units.
During driving I am not considered at either origin or destination (I am unavailable for co-located over-all conditions).
I can carry crates that hoists load into me and hoists can unload crates from me.
truck1.goal: Follow the orchestrator's plan to move between places to enable crate transport and goal stacking.

private_information: I am a hoist located at depot0 and I do not move between places.
I can lift a crate from a surface in 1 time unit; at start I must be available, the crate at the same place, the crate on the surface, and the crate clear.
Lift start effects immediately remove the crate from its surface into my grip, mark me lifting that crate, mark me not available, mark the source surface clear, and remove the on relation.

I can put down a hoist-held crate onto a surface in 1 time unit; the hoist and destination surface must remain at the place over all; at end the hoist becomes available and stops lifting and the crate is on the surface and clear and destination not clear.

I can put a hoist-held crate into a truck at the same place in 3 time units; hoist and truck must remain at place over all; effect at end places crate in truck and hoist becomes available and not lifting.

I can take a crate out of a truck in 4 time units; at start the hoist must be available and crate in truck; start effects immediately remove the crate from the truck and make the hoist not available and lifting that crate.
hoist0.goal: Perform local pick/place and load/unload actions as orchestrated to achieve global crate placement goals.

I can take a crate out of a truck in 4 time units; at start the hoist must be available and crate in truck; start effects immediately remove the crate from the truck and make the hoist not available and lifting that crate.

private_information: You are the orchestrator and will generate a combined PDDL domain and problem representing the described temporal multi-agent logistics problem.
You know the capabilities and constraints of trucks and hoists as provided and must not assume additional capabilities.
The PDDL should model timed actions with start, over-all, and end conditions/effects where appropriate, and respect co-location and over-all constraints.
orchestrator.goal: Coordinate trucks and hoists by producing a PDDL domain and problem that models the initial state and achieves the global crate placement goals while minimizing total time.

public_information: There are depots depot0 depot1 depot2.
There are distributors distributor0 distributor1 distributor2.
Trucks can drive between places taking 10 time units during which they are not considered at either endpoint.
Hoists do not move and perform all pick/place/load/unload operations.
Surfaces are pallets or crates; crates are movable and can support other crates.
Initial stacks and locations are provided in init.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent temporal PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describes the planning problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Model timed actions with start, over-all, and end conditions/effects; ensure co-location and over-all constraints are represented. Keep the actions for different kinds of agents distinct, so that there is no confusion as to which agent performs which action.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
truck0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}.
truck1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
hoist0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}.
hoist1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}.
hoist2's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}.
hoist3's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}.
hoist4's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}.
hoist5's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated temporal model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
